item.title: It is unsightly, and also a danger to residents domestic pets, plus wildlife., 27th October
item.description:
This object appeared on the 17th Oct, every neighbour i have spoken to, do not know where it has come from, and I have not seen anyone use it. Hence why I am reporting it as fly tipped. Can it be removed ASAP, as the netting is a hazardous to our pets and wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light Not Working, 27th October
item.description:
The Street Light is not working. It is supposed to illuminate as the daylight fades triggered by a light sensor However, is not being triggered to switch on, leaving a dark area near unlit garages and low fencing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harleyford, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light 2631 04 is not working and has been like this for many weeks, 27th October
item.description:
Street light 2631 04 is not working and has been like this for many weeks. Why can't someone come out and fix it. the street is dark in this spot and not safe. FIX IT PLEASE
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Shawbury Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lane is completely closed with no alternative provision, 27th October
item.description:
The cycle is closed. This is one of the busiest dedicated cycle lanes in London. It's just closed - there is no provision for alternative routes. There is no safe way to pass. Cyclists are having to go into a very busy traffic highway. It's not obvious to anyone how to get back onto the cycle lane after the roadworks. It's dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Farringdon Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
